intro: Nototriche nigrescens, commonly known as the blackened nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with silver-gray foliage that helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow to brown, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Nototriche nigrescens is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
